| A warrior:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is female.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | [monst.c#line3200](/wiki/Monst.c#line3200 "Monst.c") |

The **warrior**, @, is a [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). They are not to be confused with the [valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie_\(player_monster\) "Valkyrie (player monster)") [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), which is referred to as a warrior if generated at the appropriate level for that rank title.

All warriors are chaotic; this is likely because player Valkyries were chaotic prior to [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

By default, warriors are now lawful, but will be neutral if a player valkyrie starts out as neutral.

## Encyclopedia entry

These strange creatures live mostly on the surface of the  
earth, gathering together in societies of various forms, but  
occasionally a stray will descend into the depths and commit  
mayhem among the dungeon residents who, naturally, often  
resent the intrusion of such beasts. They are capable of  
using weapons and magic, and it is even rumored that the  
Wizard of Yendor is a member of this species.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Warrior

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the Valkyrie class title, see Valkyrie#Rank Title.
For the variant role, see Warrior (role).
@ warrior
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 1d8, weapon 1d8
@ warrior
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 1d8, weapon 1d8

Base level 5
Base experience 66
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment -1 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A warrior:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3200

The warrior, @, is a Valkyrie quest guardian. They are not to be confused with the valkyrie player monster, which is referred to as a warrior if generated at the appropriate level for that rank title.

All warriors are chaotic; this is likely because player Valkyries were chaotic prior to NetHack 3.1.0.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

By default, warriors are now lawful, but will be neutral if a player valkyrie starts out as neutral.

Encyclopedia entry

These strange creatures live mostly on the surface of the
earth, gathering together in societies of various forms, but
occasionally a stray will descend into the depths and commit
mayhem among the dungeon residents who, naturally, often
resent the intrusion of such beasts. They are capable of
using weapons and magic, and it is even rumored that the
Wizard of Yendor is a member of this species.


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

The {{questmon|warrior|valkyrie|guardian}} They are not to be confused with the [[Valkyrie (player monster)|valkyrie]] [[player monster]], which is referred to as a warrior if generated at the appropriate level for that rank title.

All warriors are chaotic; this is likely because player Valkyries were chaotic prior to [[NetHack 3.1.0]].

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|By default, warriors are now lawful, but will be neutral if a player valkyrie starts out as neutral.}}
